body: LEAD: TRACK AND FIELD Brooklyn Schools Set Records: Two Brooklyn schools, Prospect Heights and Tilden, broke meet records yesterday at the Brown University interscholastic invitation meet in Providence, R.I. body: LEAD: The Knicks are in first place in the Atlantic Division. It's a strange occurrence, considering that in the 43-year history of the franchise they have only four divisional championships and two National Basketball Association titles - in 1970 and 1973. title: NOTEBOOK; For the Knicks, Leading Division Is a Rare Feat

body: LEAD: Imagine living on the park. Across a broad boulevard is the classic marble facade of an art museum. Just a short walk away are a lake and a zoo. body: LEAD: WHEN government and private groups get together to build low-cost housing, one of the issues they face is what kind of housing makes the most economic sense. The classic high-rise apartment building can put the most families on a given piece of land, but it costs more per unit, while the low-rise town home is cheaper but uses more land. WHEN
title: Partnership Study Makes a Case For Low-Rises

body: LEAD: Students at five New York City high schools will be searched with metal detectors next fall as part of an experimental effort to reduce violence and weapon possession in the schools, the Board of Education said yesterday. title: 5 Schools to Use Detectors for Guns

title: New York Schools Consider The Use of Metal Detectors

title: New Financial Tool Revives Old Block

title: POSTINGS: Five-Story Rehab; 21 New Co-ops In Fort Greene

body: LEAD: A New York City Correction officer was arrested yesterday in Brooklyn after law-enforcement officials said he had been videotaped receiving $3,000 for having smuggled a loaded pistol to a prisoner on Rikers Island. title: Guard Held in Gun Smuggling

body: LEAD: One woman was killed, six people were injured and 27 families were forced to leave their homes when a four-alarm fire blazed through a city-owned building yesterday at 583 Franklin Street in Prospect Heights. title: Brooklyn Fire Kills One; 27 Families Are Displaced

body: LEAD: AIDS patients cannot always articulate what they are going through. AIDS patients cannot always articulate what they are going through. At the Interfaith Medical Center in Brooklyn, they don't have to. Instead, they can communicate through painting, clay and music, without ever saying a word. Led by an art therapist, Don Reid, the program is
title: AIDS Patients Speak Through Art
